intro: Visenia corchorifolia, commonly known as the common visenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically growing in woodland and grassland habitats. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. Its botanical characteristics include a slender stem and the ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Visenia corchorifolia is often noted for its ornamental value and is used in traditional herbal medicine.
